intro.description: This cheat sheet shows you how to create a new Ceylon project, a Ceylon compilation unit contained in that project, and finally run the Ceylon program.

item.title: Open the Java Perspective
item.description: We need to be in the Java Perspective. (Select Window > Open Perspective > Java from the menu bar at the top of the workbench.)

item.title: Create a Ceylon project
item.description: First, we'll create a project using the "New Ceylon Project" wizard. Select File > New > Ceylon Project, or click below. Call the project hello, and click Finish.

item.title: Create a Ceylon compilation unit
item.description: Next, we'll need a Ceylon compilation unit, which we'll create using the New Ceylon Unit wizard. Select File > New > Ceylon Project, or click below. Call the unit hello, select Create toplevel class or method declaration, choose the source folder of the project we just created, and finally click Finish.

item.title: Add the code to the method
item.description:
Next, add the following code to the body of the "hello" method:
print("hello world");.
Remember to save the file.

item.title: Run the program
item.description: Now let's run the program. Select the project or compilation unit in the Package Explorer and select Run > Run As > Ceylon Application. You should see the message in the console.
